I hope these recommendations help you find a movie that you will enjoy watching.

One movie that you might enjoy is "Mansfield Park" (1814) directed by William Wyler. This classic drama tells the story of Fanny, a young woman who is sent away by her father to live with wealthy uncle Sir Thomas and his family. Fanny must learn how to navigate the social world of her uncle's family while also struggling to come to terms with her own identity and place in the world.
Another movie that you might enjoy is "Sometimes a Great Notion" (1964) directed by Melvin Melnick. This drama tells the story of three brothers who start out as a successful not-for-profit organization called the "Great Notion", which was founded to promote social equality and human rights around the world.
Another movie that you might enjoy is "The Partner" (1997) directed by John Herzog. This drama tells the story of Jack, a widower who has recently come out of hiding after escaping from his wife's murder on the night that she died. Jack must learn how to navigate the social world of his community while also struggling to come to terms with his own identity and place in the world.
Another movie that you might enjoy is "The Future of Us" (2011) directed by David Cronenberg. This drama tells the story of 3 kids who are learning to find their way in this future world, while also struggling to come to terms with their own identity and place in the world.
